misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct control flow for nested loops)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that using an outer loop for rows and an inner loop for columns will print an increasing number of asterisks per line, followed by a newline after each row.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap: Java executes the nested loops as intended, printing i asterisks on row i and then printing a newline.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; output matches the specification for positive N.

misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct nested-loop pattern generation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that using an outer loop for rows (1..N) and an inner loop to print i asterisks per row will generate the required right triangle.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap: this matches Java’s execution model for nested loops and console printing.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; output matches the required pattern for all positive N (and prints nothing for N<=0, which is reasonable unless otherwise specified).
